intro: Mortoniella pittieri, commonly known as the Mexican rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers and is often found growing in rocky or limestone soils. It has a compact growth habit and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
